title: How to Reset Your Password
content:
# How to Reset Your Password

If you've forgotten your password or need to reset it for security reasons, follow these steps:

## Self-Service Password Reset

1. Go to the login page at https://app.example.com/login
2. Click 'Forgot Password?' below the login form
3. Enter your registered email address
4. Click 'Send Reset Link'
5. Check your email inbox (and spam folder) for the reset email
6. Click the reset link within 24 hours (links expire after this)
7. Enter your new password (must be at least 12 characters with uppercase, lowercase, number, and special character)
8. Confirm the new password
9. Click 'Reset Password'

## Common Issues

### Not Receiving Reset Email
- Check your spam/junk folder
- Whitelist noreply@example.com
- Ensure you're using the correct email address
- Wait 5 minutes before requesting another email
- Corporate email filters may block our emails - contact your IT department
- Gmail users: check 'Promotions' and 'Updates' tabs

### Reset Link Expired
- Request a new reset link
- Links are valid for 24 hours only
- Each new request invalidates previous links

### Password Requirements Not Met
- Minimum 12 characters
- At least one uppercase letter (A-Z)
- At least one lowercase letter (a-z)
- At least one number (0-9)
- At least one special character (!@#$%^&*)
- Cannot match your last 5 passwords
- Cannot contain your email address or name

## Security Best Practices

- Don't reuse passwords from other sites
- Consider using a password manager
- Enable two-factor authentication after resetting
- Never share your password with anyone
- Change your password immediately if you suspect compromise

title: Understanding Your Bill and Charges
content:
# Understanding Your Bill and Charges

This guide explains how our billing works and how to understand your invoices.

## Billing Cycle

- **Monthly Plans**: Billed on the same day each month
- **Annual Plans**: Billed once per year on the subscription anniversary
- **Prorated Charges**: When upgrading mid-cycle, you pay the difference

## Invoice Components

Your invoice includes:

1. **Base Subscription Fee**: The cost of your plan tier
2. **Per-User Charges**: Additional user seats (if applicable)
3. **Add-ons**: Optional features like advanced analytics, priority support
4. **Usage Charges**: API calls, storage, etc. beyond included limits
5. **Taxes**: Applicable sales tax or VAT based on your location

## Common Billing Questions

### Why Was I Charged Twice?
- Check if one charge is for a different billing period
- Monthly and annual renewals might overlap during plan changes
- Authorization holds may appear as separate charges (released within 3-5 days)
- Contact support with both charge dates for investigation

### How to Update Payment Method
1. Go to Settings > Billing
2. Click 'Payment Methods'
3. Add new card or bank account
4. Set as default payment method
5. Optionally remove old payment method

### Requesting a Refund
- Refunds are available within 30 days of charge
- Annual plans: Prorated refund for unused months
- Contact billing@example.com with your order ID
- Refunds processed within 5-10 business days

## Pricing Plans

| Plan | Monthly | Annual (Save 20%) | Users Included |
|------|---------|-------------------|----------------|
| Starter | $9/user | $86/user/year | 1-5 |
| Team | $15/user | $144/user/year | 5-25 |
| Business | $25/user | $240/user/year | 25-100 |
| Enterprise | Custom | Custom | Unlimited |

## Tax Information

- US: Sales tax varies by state
- EU: VAT charged based on country
- Provide VAT ID in Settings > Billing to apply exemption
- Tax-exempt organizations: Upload certificate in Settings > Billing

title: Troubleshooting Application Crashes
content:
# Troubleshooting Application Crashes

If the application is crashing or not responding, try these troubleshooting steps.

## Quick Fixes

### 1. Restart the Application
- Close the application completely (check Task Manager/Activity Monitor)
- Wait 10 seconds
- Reopen the application

### 2. Clear Cache and Temporary Files
**Windows:**
1. Press Win + R
2. Type `%appdata%\ExampleApp\cache`
3. Delete all files in this folder

**Mac:**
1. Open Finder
2. Go to ~/Library/Application Support/ExampleApp/cache
3. Delete all files in this folder

### 3. Update to Latest Version
1. Open Settings > About
2. Check for updates
3. Install if available and restart

## Common Crash Scenarios

### Crash on Startup
- Corrupt installation: Uninstall and reinstall
- Conflicting software: Disable antivirus temporarily
- Insufficient permissions: Run as administrator
- Graphics driver issues: Update your GPU drivers

### Crash When Opening Files
- File may be corrupted: Try a different file
- File too large: Check system memory
- Unsupported format: Verify file type is supported

### Crash When Exporting (Error 0x80070005)
- Insufficient disk space: Free up at least 1GB storage
- Permission issues: Check write access to destination folder
- Export format bug: Try different format (PDF, DOCX, CSV)
- Antivirus blocking: Add exception for ExampleApp
- Run as administrator if permission denied

### White Screen / Not Responding
- Clear browser cache if using web version
- Disable hardware acceleration in Settings > Advanced
- Check for corrupted user profile
- Try in incognito/private browsing mode

## Collecting Crash Logs

**Windows:**
`%appdata%\ExampleApp\logs\crash_*.log`

**Mac:**
`~/Library/Logs/ExampleApp/`

**Linux:**
`~/.config/ExampleApp/logs/`

## System Requirements

- **OS**: Windows 10+, macOS 11+, Ubuntu 20.04+
- **RAM**: 4GB minimum, 8GB recommended
- **Storage**: 500MB free space
- **Internet**: Required for sync features
- **Browser**: Chrome 90+, Firefox 90+, Safari 14+, Edge 90+

## Contact Support

If issues persist, contact support with:
1. Your operating system and version
2. Application version (Settings > About)
3. Steps to reproduce the crash
4. Crash log files
5. Screenshot of error message

title: Setting Up Two-Factor Authentication (2FA)
content:
# Setting Up Two-Factor Authentication (2FA)

Two-factor authentication adds an extra layer of security to your account.

## Setting Up 2FA

### Using an Authenticator App (Recommended)

1. Download an authenticator app:
   - Google Authenticator (iOS/Android)
   - Microsoft Authenticator (iOS/Android)
   - Authy (iOS/Android/Desktop)
   - 1Password (if you use it for passwords)

2. In our app, go to Settings > Security > Two-Factor Authentication
3. Click 'Enable 2FA'
4. Scan the QR code with your authenticator app
5. Enter the 6-digit code from your app to verify
6. **IMPORTANT**: Save the backup codes in a secure location

### Using SMS (Less Secure)

1. Go to Settings > Security > Two-Factor Authentication
2. Select 'SMS' as your method
3. Enter your phone number
4. Verify with the code sent to your phone

## Using 2FA to Login

1. Enter your email and password as usual
2. When prompted, enter the 6-digit code from your authenticator app
3. Codes refresh every 30 seconds

## Backup Codes

- You receive 10 backup codes when setting up 2FA
- Each code can only be used once
- Store them safely (password manager, printed in secure location)
- Generate new codes if you run out

## Common Issues

### Codes Not Working / Being Rejected
- Ensure your phone's time is synced automatically (Settings > Date & Time > Automatic)
- Make sure you're using the correct account in your authenticator
- Try the next code (they change every 30 seconds)
- Check if you're looking at the right service entry in the app
- Time zone differences can cause issues - ensure automatic time sync

### Lost Access to Authenticator
1. Use a backup code to login
2. Go to Settings > Security
3. Disable and re-enable 2FA with new device

### Lost Phone / New Phone
1. If you have backup codes, use one to login
2. Go to Settings > Security > Two-Factor Authentication
3. Click 'Reset 2FA' and set up on new device
4. If no backup codes, contact support with identity verification

### Lost Backup Codes
- If you can still login, generate new backup codes in Settings
- If locked out, contact support with identity verification
- You'll need to verify identity via government ID or other means

title: API Rate Limits and Best Practices
content:
# API Rate Limits and Best Practices

Our API has rate limits to ensure fair usage and system stability.

## Rate Limits by Plan

| Plan | Requests/Minute | Requests/Day | Concurrent Connections |
|------|-----------------|--------------|------------------------|
| Starter | 100 | 10,000 | 5 |
| Team | 500 | 50,000 | 25 |
| Business | 1,000 | 100,000 | 50 |
| Enterprise | 2,000+ | Custom | Custom |

## Rate Limit Headers

Every API response includes:

```
X-RateLimit-Limit: 1000
X-RateLimit-Remaining: 999
X-RateLimit-Reset: 1702656000
```

## Handling Rate Limits

### HTTP 429 Response

When you exceed the rate limit:

```json
{
  "error": "rate_limit_exceeded",
  "message": "Too many requests",
  "retry_after": 60
}
```

### Best Practices

1. **Implement Exponential Backoff**
   ```python
   def retry_with_backoff(func, max_retries=5):
       for i in range(max_retries):
           try:
               return func()
           except RateLimitError:
               wait = (2 ** i) + random.uniform(0, 1)
               time.sleep(wait)
   ```

2. **Cache Responses**
   - Cache GET requests when data doesn't change frequently
   - Use ETags for conditional requests

3. **Batch Operations**
   - Use batch endpoints instead of individual calls
   - Combine multiple operations in single requests

4. **Monitor Usage**
   - Track the X-RateLimit-Remaining header
   - Slow down when approaching limits

## Troubleshooting 429 Errors

### Getting 429 Below Your Limit?
- Check if multiple API keys share the same account limit
- Verify you're reading the correct plan limits
- Burst traffic can hit per-second limits even if under per-minute
- Check for runaway processes making duplicate requests
- Contact support with your API key suffix (last 4 chars) for investigation

## Webhooks as Alternative

Instead of polling, use webhooks for real-time updates:

```
POST /webhooks
{
  "url": "https://yourapp.com/webhook",
  "events": ["item.created", "item.updated"]
}
```

## Requesting Higher Limits

- Enterprise plans can request custom limits
- Contact sales@example.com with your use case
- Include expected request volume and patterns

title: Managing Team Members and Permissions
content:
# Managing Team Members and Permissions

Learn how to add, remove, and manage team member access.

## Roles and Permissions

| Role | Capabilities |
|------|-------------|
| Owner | Full access, billing, delete workspace |
| Admin | Manage users, settings, no billing |
| Member | Use all features, limited settings |
| Viewer | Read-only access |

## Adding Team Members

1. Go to Settings > Team
2. Click 'Invite Members'
3. Enter email addresses (comma-separated for multiple)
4. Select role for each member
5. Click 'Send Invitations'

### Invitation Expiry
- Invitations expire after 7 days
- Resend invitations from the Pending tab

## Removing Team Members

1. Go to Settings > Team
2. Find the member in the list
3. Click the three-dot menu
4. Select 'Remove from Team'
5. Choose what happens to their content:
   - Transfer to another member
   - Delete permanently
   - Keep but make owner-only

## Changing Roles

1. Go to Settings > Team
2. Click on a member's current role
3. Select the new role from dropdown
4. Confirm the change

## Transferring Ownership

Only one owner per workspace:

1. Go to Settings > Team
2. Click 'Transfer Ownership'
3. Select the new owner
4. Verify with your password
5. The previous owner becomes an Admin

## Security Best Practices

- Review team access quarterly
- Remove departed employees immediately
- Use least-privilege principle (assign minimum required role)
- Enable 2FA requirement for all members
- Review activity logs for suspicious behavior

title: Canceling Your Subscription
content:
# Canceling Your Subscription

We're sorry to see you go. Here's how to cancel your subscription.

## How to Cancel

1. Log into your account
2. Go to Settings > Billing
3. Click 'Cancel Subscription'
4. Select a reason for canceling (helps us improve)
5. Confirm cancellation

## What Happens After Cancellation

### Immediate Effects
- No immediate changes to your account
- Continue using all features until period ends
- Auto-renewal is turned off

### At End of Billing Period
- Account converts to Free tier
- Features above Free tier become inaccessible
- Data is retained for 90 days
- After 90 days, data may be deleted

## Refund Policy

### Monthly Plans
- No refunds for partial months
- Service continues until end of paid period

### Annual Plans
- Prorated refund available within first 30 days
- After 30 days: No refund, service continues until end of year
- Contact billing@example.com for refund requests
- Include your Order ID (format: ORD-YYYY-MM-XXXXX)

## Before You Go

### Export Your Data
1. Go to Settings > Data Export
2. Select what to export (all data or specific items)
3. Choose format (JSON, CSV)
4. Download the export file

### Consider Alternatives
- **Downgrade**: Switch to a cheaper plan instead
- **Pause**: Enterprise accounts can pause for up to 3 months
- **Transfer**: Give your account to a colleague

## Reactivating

Changed your mind? Within 90 days:
1. Log in to your account
2. Go to Settings > Billing
3. Click 'Reactivate Subscription'
4. All your data will be restored

## Contact Support

If you're having issues that led to cancellation, we'd love to help resolve them first. Contact support@example.com.

title: Data Sync Troubleshooting
content:
# Data Sync Troubleshooting

If your data isn't syncing between devices, try these solutions.

## How Sync Works

- Changes sync automatically when online
- Typical sync delay: 1-5 seconds
- Offline changes sync when reconnected
- Sync requires same account on all devices

## Quick Fixes

### 1. Check Internet Connection
- Ensure you're connected to the internet
- Try loading a website to verify
- Check if other apps can connect

### 2. Force Sync
- **Mobile**: Pull down to refresh
- **Desktop**: File > Sync Now or Ctrl/Cmd + Shift + S
- **Web**: Click the sync icon in toolbar

### 3. Check Sync Status
Look for the sync indicator:
- ✓ Green check: Synced
- ↻ Spinning: Syncing
- ⚠ Yellow warning: Sync issues
- ✗ Red X: Offline or error

## Common Sync Issues

### Different Data on Different Devices

1. Ensure all devices are online
2. Force sync on each device
3. Check if you're logged into the same account
4. Verify you're in the same workspace
5. Check app versions match (update all to latest)

### Mobile Not Syncing to Desktop
- Verify same account email on both devices
- Check mobile app background refresh is enabled
- Ensure mobile app isn't restricted by battery saver
- Update both apps to latest version
- Try logging out and back in on mobile

### Sync Conflicts

When the same item is edited on multiple devices:
- The most recent change wins
- Conflict copies may be created (named 'Copy - Conflict')
- Review and merge manually

### Sync Stuck / Not Working After Update

1. Log out and log back in
2. Clear cache (Settings > Advanced > Clear Cache)
3. Reinstall the application
4. Check our status page for known issues

## Advanced Troubleshooting

### Check Service Status
Visit status.example.com for outages

### Firewall Settings
Ensure these domains are whitelisted:
- api.example.com
- sync.example.com
- *.cloudfront.net

### Proxy Configuration
If behind a proxy, configure in:
Settings > Network > Proxy Settings

## When to Contact Support

- Sync issues persist after trying all steps
- Data appears corrupted
- Sync hasn't worked for over 24 hours

Include:
- Device types and OS versions
- App versions on all devices
- Description of what's not syncing

title: Account Deletion and Data Privacy
content:
# Account Deletion and Data Privacy

Your privacy matters. Here's how to delete your account and understand our data practices.

## Deleting Your Account

### Prerequisites
- Cancel any active subscription first
- Export any data you want to keep
- If you're a workspace owner, transfer ownership first

### Steps to Delete

1. Go to Settings > Account > Delete Account
2. Read the warning about data deletion
3. Enter your password to confirm identity
4. Type 'DELETE' to confirm
5. Click 'Permanently Delete Account'

### Delete Button Grayed Out?
- You may have an active subscription - cancel it first
- You may be a workspace owner - transfer ownership first
- Outstanding balance on account - settle payment first
- Contact support if button remains disabled after addressing above

### What Gets Deleted

- Your profile and settings
- All your created content
- Your comments and contributions
- Activity history
- API keys and integrations

### What's Retained

- Aggregated analytics (anonymized)
- Content you shared in team workspaces (owned by workspace)
- Billing records (required by law, anonymized)

## GDPR Rights

If you're in the EU, you have the right to:

### Right to Access
Request a copy of your data:
Settings > Privacy > Download My Data

### Right to Rectification
Correct inaccurate data in your profile settings

### Right to Erasure
Delete your account as described above

### Right to Portability
Export your data in standard formats (JSON, CSV)

### Right to Object
Opt out of marketing: Settings > Notifications

## Data Retention

| Data Type | Retention Period |
|-----------|------------------|
| Account data | Until deletion |
| Usage logs | 90 days |
| Billing records | 7 years (legal) |
| Backups | 30 days after deletion |
| Support tickets | 2 years |

## Contact Our DPO

For privacy concerns:
- Email: privacy@example.com
- Address: Data Protection Officer, Example Inc., 123 Main St, City, Country
- Response time: Within 30 days

title: Login and Authentication Issues
content:
# Login and Authentication Issues

Can't log in? Here's how to troubleshoot common login problems.

## Invalid Credentials Error

### Verify Your Email
- Check for typos in your email address
- Ensure you're using the correct email (work vs personal)
- Try copy-pasting your email to avoid typos

### Password Issues
- Caps Lock may be on
- Keyboard language might have changed
- Try typing password in a visible text field first
- Reset password if unsure: Click 'Forgot Password?'

### Recently Changed Password?
- New password may take a few minutes to propagate
- Clear browser cache and cookies
- Try an incognito/private window

## Account Locked

After 5 failed login attempts, your account is temporarily locked:
- Wait 30 minutes for automatic unlock
- Or click 'Forgot Password?' to reset and unlock immediately
- Contact support if locked out repeatedly

## SSO (Single Sign-On) Issues

### SSO Login Not Working
- Check if your organization's SSO provider is operational
- Clear browser cache and try again
- Contact your IT department for SSO configuration
- Ensure you're using the correct SSO portal URL

### SSO vs Password Login
- If your organization uses SSO, direct password login may be disabled
- Use your company's SSO portal to authenticate
- Contact your IT admin if unsure which to use

## Browser-Related Issues

### Login Button Not Responding
- Disable browser extensions (especially ad blockers)
- Clear cookies for our domain
- Try a different browser
- Disable VPN temporarily

### Infinite Login Loop
- Clear all cookies and cache
- Disable third-party cookie blocking
- Check if JavaScript is enabled
- Try incognito mode

## Security Verification

We may require additional verification if:
- Logging in from new location
- Using a new device
- Unusual activity detected

Check your email for a verification code.

## Unauthorized Access Detected

If you receive an alert about unauthorized access:
1. Reset your password immediately
2. Enable 2FA if not already active
3. Review active sessions in Settings > Security
4. Revoke any unrecognized sessions
5. Contact support to report the incident

title: Billing Disputes and Duplicate Charges
content:
# Billing Disputes and Duplicate Charges

If you've noticed unexpected charges on your account, here's how to resolve them.

## Identifying Duplicate Charges

### What Looks Like a Duplicate But Isn't
- **Authorization holds**: Temporary pending charges that disappear in 3-5 days
- **Plan upgrades**: Prorated charges for mid-cycle changes
- **Different billing periods**: Check dates on each charge
- **Add-ons**: Additional features billed separately
- **User seat additions**: Per-user charges for new team members

### Actual Duplicate Charges
True duplicates have:
- Same exact amount
- Same billing period
- Same invoice number (rare)

## Requesting a Refund for Duplicates

1. Gather information:
   - Both charge dates
   - Exact amounts
   - Last 4 digits of card charged
   - Screenshot of bank statement (redact sensitive info)

2. Contact billing support:
   - Email: billing@example.com
   - Subject: "Duplicate Charge - [Your Customer ID]"
   - Include all gathered information

3. Resolution timeline:
   - Investigation: 1-2 business days
   - Refund processing: 5-10 business days
   - Bank posting: Additional 2-5 days

## Disputing Other Charges

### Charged After Cancellation
- Check if cancellation was confirmed (look for confirmation email)
- Verify the charge date vs your billing cycle end date
- Service continues until end of paid period

### Unexpected Price Increase
- Review email notifications (we notify 30 days in advance)
- Check if plan was automatically upgraded due to usage
- Annual plans lock in price for the year

### Charged Wrong Amount
- Verify current plan pricing in Settings > Billing
- Check for tax changes based on location
- Review any add-ons or overages

## Preventing Future Issues

- Enable email receipts for every charge
- Set up billing alerts in Settings > Notifications
- Review billing section monthly
- Keep payment method up to date to avoid retry charges

title: Webhook Configuration and Troubleshooting
content:
# Webhook Configuration and Troubleshooting

Learn how to set up and troubleshoot webhooks for real-time notifications.

## Setting Up Webhooks

1. Go to Settings > Integrations > Webhooks
2. Click 'Add Webhook'
3. Enter your endpoint URL (must be HTTPS)
4. Select events you want to receive
5. Add optional secret for signature verification
6. Click 'Save'

## Available Events

- `item.created` - New item created
- `item.updated` - Item modified
- `item.deleted` - Item removed
- `user.added` - Team member added
- `user.removed` - Team member removed
- `payment.completed` - Successful payment
- `payment.failed` - Failed payment attempt

## Webhook Payload Format

```json
{
  "event": "item.created",
  "timestamp": "2025-12-15T10:30:00Z",
  "data": {
    "id": "item_123",
    "name": "Example Item",
    "created_by": "user_456"
  },
  "signature": "sha256=..."
}
```

## Troubleshooting Webhooks

### Not Receiving Webhooks

1. **Verify endpoint is accessible**
   - Must be HTTPS (HTTP not supported)
   - Must return 200 status code
   - Must respond within 30 seconds

2. **Check firewall settings**
   - Whitelist our IP ranges (see Settings > Webhooks > IP List)
   - Ensure port 443 is open

3. **Test with webhook.site**
   - Use temporary endpoint to verify we're sending
   - Compare with your endpoint logs

### Delayed Webhooks

Webhooks may be delayed due to:
- High system load (we queue and retry)
- Your endpoint returning errors (triggers retry with backoff)
- Network latency

**Normal delivery time**: <5 seconds
**Maximum retry period**: 24 hours

### Failed Delivery Retries

We retry failed webhooks with exponential backoff:
- Attempt 1: Immediate
- Attempt 2: 1 minute
- Attempt 3: 5 minutes
- Attempt 4: 30 minutes
- Attempt 5: 2 hours
- Final attempt: 24 hours

### Viewing Webhook Logs

Go to Settings > Integrations > Webhooks > Logs to see:
- Delivery attempts
- Response codes from your endpoint
- Payload sent
- Error messages

## Best Practices

- Return 200 quickly, process async
- Implement idempotency (handle duplicate events)
- Verify webhook signatures
- Log all received webhooks for debugging
- Set up monitoring for your endpoint

title: Performance Issues and Slow Loading
content:
# Performance Issues and Slow Loading

If the application is running slowly, try these optimization tips.

## Quick Performance Fixes

### 1. Clear Cache
- **Web**: Clear browser cache or try incognito
- **Desktop**: Settings > Advanced > Clear Cache
- **Mobile**: Clear app data or reinstall

### 2. Check Internet Connection
- Test speed at speedtest.net
- Minimum recommended: 5 Mbps download
- Try wired connection instead of WiFi

### 3. Close Unused Tabs/Applications
- Each browser tab uses memory
- Background apps compete for resources
- Restart browser if open for extended periods

## Large File Performance

### Files Over 50MB Loading Slowly

**Causes:**
- Insufficient RAM for file processing
- HDD instead of SSD storage
- Complex file content requiring parsing

**Solutions:**
- Close other applications to free memory
- Enable 'Lightweight Mode' in Settings > Performance
- Split large files into smaller segments
- Upgrade to SSD storage for better I/O

### Recommended Specs for Large Files

| File Size | RAM | Storage | Processor |
|-----------|-----|---------|----------|
| <10MB | 4GB | Any | Any modern |
| 10-50MB | 8GB | SSD | i5/Ryzen 5+ |
| 50-100MB | 16GB | NVMe | i7/Ryzen 7+ |
| >100MB | 32GB | NVMe | i7/Ryzen 7+ |

## Browser-Specific Issues

### Chrome
- Disable hardware acceleration if graphics issues
- Limit extensions to essential only
- Update to latest version

### Firefox
- Reset Firefox if performance degraded over time
- Disable unused add-ons

### Safari
- Clear website data specifically for our domain
- Disable content blockers temporarily

## When Performance Degraded After Update

1. Check system requirements for new version
2. Clear cache completely
3. Log out and log back in
4. Report to support with version numbers

## Monitoring Performance

- Settings > Performance shows resource usage
- Enable performance logging for troubleshooting
- Share logs with support when reporting issues

title: Upgrading Your Subscription Plan
content:
# Upgrading Your Subscription Plan

Ready to unlock more features? Here's how to upgrade your plan.

## How to Upgrade

1. Go to Settings > Billing
2. Click 'Change Plan' or 'Upgrade'
3. Select your desired plan
4. Review the pricing and features
5. Apply any discount codes
6. Confirm upgrade

## Understanding Proration

When you upgrade mid-billing cycle:
- You're credited for unused time on current plan
- You're charged the prorated amount for new plan
- Next full billing occurs on your regular date

**Example:**
- Upgrade from Team ($15/user) to Business ($25/user) on day 15 of 30-day cycle
- Credit: 15 days of Team = $7.50/user
- Charge: 15 days of Business = $12.50/user
- Net charge: $5/user for remainder of cycle

## Plan Comparison

| Feature | Starter | Team | Business | Enterprise |
|---------|---------|------|----------|------------|
| Users | 1-5 | 5-25 | 25-100 | Unlimited |
| Storage | 10GB | 100GB | 1TB | Custom |
| API Calls | 10K/mo | 50K/mo | 100K/mo | Custom |
| Support | Email | Priority | 24/7 Phone | Dedicated |
| SSO | No | No | Yes | Yes |
| Custom Domain | No | No | Yes | Yes |
| SLA | No | 99.5% | 99.9% | 99.99% |

## Upgrading to Enterprise

Enterprise plans require a custom quote:

1. Click 'Contact Sales' or email sales@example.com
2. Describe your needs:
   - Number of users
   - Required integrations
   - Compliance requirements
   - Support expectations
3. Schedule a demo call
4. Receive custom proposal
5. Complete procurement process

## Migration Process

- Data automatically transfers to new plan
- All settings preserved
- Integrations continue working
- Users retain their permissions
- No downtime during upgrade

## Downgrading

If you need to downgrade:
- Happens at end of current billing period
- Ensure data fits within new plan limits
- Export data exceeding limits before downgrade
- Some features may become unavailable

title: Account Security and Unauthorized Access
content:
# Account Security and Unauthorized Access

If you suspect unauthorized access to your account, act immediately.

## Signs of Unauthorized Access

- Login notifications from unknown locations
- Password changed without your action
- Unfamiliar activity in your account
- Missing or modified content
- Unknown devices in active sessions
- Email address changed unexpectedly

## Immediate Steps

### 1. Secure Your Account
1. Change your password immediately
2. Enable 2FA if not already active
3. Review and revoke all active sessions:
   - Settings > Security > Active Sessions
   - Click 'Sign out all other sessions'

### 2. Check for Damage
- Review recent activity log
- Check for deleted content (may be in Trash)
- Verify payment methods unchanged
- Check connected integrations

### 3. Report the Incident
Contact security@example.com with:
- Your account email
- When you noticed the issue
- Any suspicious activity details
- Unknown IP addresses from login history

## Recovering Compromised Account

### If You Can Still Login
1. Change password
2. Enable/reset 2FA
3. Review and update security settings
4. Check for unauthorized billing changes

### If You're Locked Out
1. Use 'Forgot Password' to reset
2. If email compromised, contact support@example.com
3. Be prepared for identity verification
4. Provide account details (creation date, recent activity)

## Preventing Future Incidents

1. **Use Strong, Unique Passwords**
   - Minimum 12 characters
   - Don't reuse across sites
   - Use a password manager

2. **Enable Two-Factor Authentication**
   - Use authenticator app over SMS
   - Save backup codes securely

3. **Review Security Regularly**
   - Check active sessions monthly
   - Review connected apps quarterly
   - Update passwords annually

4. **Be Wary of Phishing**
   - We never ask for password via email
   - Check URL before entering credentials
   - Report suspicious emails to security@example.com

## Security Incident Response SLA

- Critical (account compromise): Response within 1 hour
- High (suspicious activity): Response within 4 hours
- Medium (security questions): Response within 24 hours

title: Export and Data Portability
content:
# Export and Data Portability

You own your data. Here's how to export it.

## Standard Data Export

1. Go to Settings > Data > Export
2. Select what to export:
   - All data
   - Specific workspaces
   - Specific date range
3. Choose format:
   - JSON (machine-readable, complete)
   - CSV (spreadsheet-compatible, tabular data)
   - PDF (human-readable reports)
4. Click 'Start Export'
5. Download link sent to your email

## Export Formats Explained

### JSON Export
- Complete data with all metadata
- Relationships preserved
- Best for data migration or backup
- Can be imported into other systems

### CSV Export
- Tabular data only
- Opens in Excel, Google Sheets
- Good for analysis and reporting
- Multiple files for different data types

### PDF Export
- Formatted for reading/printing
- Good for archival purposes
- Not suitable for re-import

## Export Limitations

| Plan | Export Frequency | File Size Limit |
|------|------------------|------------------|
| Free | Once per month | 100MB |
| Starter | Weekly | 1GB |
| Team | Daily | 5GB |
| Business | Unlimited | 25GB |
| Enterprise | Unlimited | Unlimited |

## API Data Access

For programmatic access:
```
GET /api/v1/export
Authorization: Bearer YOUR_API_KEY
```

See API documentation for full export endpoints.

## Exporting Before Account Deletion

1. Export all data first
2. Verify export completeness
3. Download and secure locally
4. Then proceed with account deletion

**Data retained 90 days after deletion for recovery purposes.**

## Importing to Other Services

Our JSON format is compatible with:
- Notion (via import tool)
- Coda (via JSON import)
- Airtable (via CSV conversion)
- Custom applications (via API)

See our migration guides at docs.example.com/migration

title: Mobile App Troubleshooting
content:
# Mobile App Troubleshooting

Solve common issues with our iOS and Android apps.

## Installation Issues

### App Won't Install

**iOS:**
- Requires iOS 14 or later
- Need 150MB free space
- Check Apple ID payment method is valid
- Try: Settings > General > iPhone Storage > offload unused apps

**Android:**
- Requires Android 8.0 or later
- Need 100MB free space
- Enable 'Install unknown apps' if sideloading
- Clear Play Store cache

### App Won't Open

1. Force close the app
2. Restart your device
3. Update to latest version
4. Uninstall and reinstall

## Sync Issues on Mobile

### Changes Not Syncing

1. Check internet connection
2. Pull down to force refresh
3. Log out and log back in
4. Clear app cache:
   - iOS: Delete and reinstall
   - Android: Settings > Apps > [App] > Clear Cache

### Background Sync Not Working

**iOS:**
- Settings > [App] > Background App Refresh > On
- Don't have Low Power Mode enabled

**Android:**
- Settings > Apps > [App] > Battery > Not optimized
- Disable battery saver for the app
- Enable 'Allow background data usage'

## Login Issues on Mobile

### Can't Login After Password Change
1. Log out completely on mobile
2. Clear app cache/data
3. Log in with new password

### Biometric Login Not Working
1. Re-enroll fingerprint/Face ID in device settings
2. Disable and re-enable in app settings
3. Ensure screen lock is enabled on device

## Push Notifications

### Not Receiving Notifications

**iOS:**
1. Settings > Notifications > [App] > Allow Notifications
2. Check notification preferences in-app
3. Check Do Not Disturb settings

**Android:**
1. Settings > Apps > [App] > Notifications > Enable
2. Check notification channels
3. Disable Battery Optimization for app

## Performance on Mobile

### App Running Slowly
- Close background apps
- Clear app cache
- Ensure sufficient storage (keep 1GB+ free)
- Update to latest app version

### High Battery Usage
- Disable background sync if not needed
- Reduce sync frequency
- Disable push notifications for non-critical events

# Contacting Support and SLA Information

## Support Channels

### In-App Support

### Live Chat
- Available for Team plans and above
- Hours: Mon-Fri, 9am-6pm (your timezone)
- Access via the chat icon in-app

### Phone Support
- Business and Enterprise plans only
- 24/7 for Enterprise
- Number provided in Settings > Support

## Response Time SLA

| Priority | Free | Starter | Team | Business | Enterprise |
|----------|------|---------|------|----------|------------|
| P1-Critical | 24h | 12h | 4h | 1h | 15min |
| P2-High | 48h | 24h | 8h | 4h | 1h |
| P3-Medium | 5d | 3d | 24h | 8h | 4h |
| P4-Low | Best effort | 5d | 3d | 24h | 8h |

## Priority Definitions

- **P1-Critical**: Service completely unavailable, data loss risk
- **P2-High**: Major feature broken, no workaround
- **P3-Medium**: Feature issue with workaround available
- **P4-Low**: Minor issue, questions, feature requests

## What to Include in Support Requests

For fastest resolution, include:

1. **Account Info**: Customer ID or account email
2. **Issue Description**: What happened? What did you expect?
3. **Steps to Reproduce**: How can we recreate the issue?
4. **Environment**: Browser/OS/app version
5. **Screenshots/Videos**: Visual evidence if applicable
6. **Error Messages**: Exact text of any errors
7. **When It Started**: First occurrence, frequency

## Checking Ticket Status

1. Go to Settings > Support > My Tickets
2. View all open and closed tickets
3. Reply directly in the thread
4. Rate your support experience when resolved
